tool.name: Metabolomics 2-way differential abundance

param.name: qval
param.label: q-value for FDR
param.help: q-value for false discovery rate, using the Benjamini-Hochberg procedure

param.name: treatment_name
param.label: Name of treatment group. This will be the numerator for fold change calculations.

param.name: control_name
param.label: Name of control group. This will be the denominator for fold change calculations.

tool.help:
Do differential abundance analysis for each metabolite in the input data.
1. Does normalization and other processing to get the data ready for statistical analysis 2. From (1), do differential abundance analysis, using multiple t-tests, one for each metabolite. We control for false discovery rate using the Benjamini-Hochberg procedure.
Input is a `tsv` file of raw abundance counts, before any kind of normalization.
- Sample names are the first column - Group names are the second column - The rest of the columns are metabolites/compounds. - The input data may contain more than 2 groups, but a single run of this module will only compare a "treatment group" of your choosing against a "control group" of your choosing. These are specified in the input text fields (watch out for spelling errors!). See tool <TOOL_NAME_HERE> for >2-way comparison.
Procedure:
1. Duplicate column names are preserved; one of the duplicates will have a "_1" appended to it. 2. Zero or blank values will be replaced with half of the smallest nonzero value in the input table. 3. Log2 transform the data, then perform row(sample)-wise median normalization. 4. Do a t-test for each metabolite to test for differential abundance. 5. Control FDR with Benjamini-Hochberg.
Command:
::
Rscript --vanilla metab-de.R <input_filename> <p_value> <q_value> <treatment_group_name> <control_group_name> <output_filename>
Inputs:
-input_filename absolute path to input file. -p_value p-value threshold for t-tests. -q_value q-value threshold for multiple hypothesis testing correction (Benjamini-Hochberg). -treatment_group_name name of treatment group; fold change numerator -control_group_name name of control group; fold change denominator -output_filename absolute path to output file.
